Title: FG targets trillion-dollar economy via new tech talents
Summary: The Federal Government has reaffirmed its commitment to transforming Nigeria into a trillion-dollar economy through strategic investment in digital and technical skills . Federal Government reaffirms commitment to investing in digital skills .

Title: BOI, NCGC unveil N10b guaranteed loans
Summary: Bank of Industry (BOI) and National Credit Guarantee Company (NCGC) launched a N10 billion loan guarantee programme aimed at improving access to finance for women-owned businesses . Nigeria's push for inclusive economic growth gained momentum on Wednesday .

Title: ‘Border communities are vital to ending HIV/AIDS in Nigeria’
Summary: The Nigerian Business Coalition Against AIDS (NiBUCAA) has urged increased HIV screening at border communities . The high mobility of people between Seme and neighbouring countries such as Togo and Ghana is a major factor in HIV transmission .

Title: The conviction of ISWAP commander as a lesson for others
Summary: The message in the recent court conviction and imprisonment of a commander of the Islamic State West Africa Province (ISWAP) is clear that those who inflict terror on society will not go scot-free without being subjected to justice . The conviction of ISWAP commander as a lesson for others .

Title: Budget turmoil deepens as Tinubu prepares 2026 estimates ahead of MTEF approval
Summary: Nigeria’s fiscal anxieties have widened as President Bola Ahmed Tinubu prepares to lay the 2026 Appropriation Bill before the National Assembly next week . Despite the delayed presentation and non-passage of the bill, Nigeria's fiscal anxiety has widened .

Title: Nigeria’s oil output drops to 1.486m bpd in November- OPEC
Summary: OPEC says Nigeria's oil output dropped by 0.7 percent to 1.486 million barrels per day, bpd in November . Organisation does not consider Condensate, which Nigeria produces about 196,028 bpd, according to the Nigerian .

Title: You were “Hero of Political Integrity,” PDP mourns Bayelsa Deputy Governor
Summary: PDP mourns Senator Lawrence Oborawharievwo Ewhrudjakpo, who reportedly collapsed and died earlier today . The party described the Deputy Governor as a ‘trusted, faithful party man’ and a “hero of political integrity”

Title: Soludo commits to improving aviation infrastructure
Summary: Governor Chukwuma Charles Soludo reaffirmed his administration’s commitment to improving aviation infrastructure across the state . Speaking at the commissioning of a new Protocol Lounge at Chinåa Achebe International Airport in Anambra State, Soludo said that it is part of a plan to enhance the state's aviation landscape .

Title: CBN to create short code to fast-track complaint resolution
Summary: CBN working with Nigerian Communications Commission to create industry-wide short code . Short code will allow consumers to communicate with their financial institutions anytime, anywhere, with or without internet access . CBN Director, Consumer Protection and Financial Inclusion Department, Dr. Aisha Isa-Olatinwo, disclosed this at a meeting .

Title: Dollar to Naira exchange rate today, December 12, 2025
Summary: The Nigerian Naira displayed a mixed performance against the US Dollar on Friday, December 12, 2025 . The official window of the Nigerian Foreign Exchange Market maintained a familiar trading band . The parallel market witnessed a marginal appreciation for the NairA, reducing the market's premium .

Title: AGILE project trains 65 focal persons to tackle GBV in Sokoto
Summary: The Adolescent Girls Initiative for Learning and Empowerment Project has commenced the training of 65 focal persons to strengthen their ability to handle grievances and cases of gender-based violence . The training focuses on the Grievance Redress Mechanism targeting traditional rulers, religious leaders, education officers and community stakeholders .

Title: Calm returns to Benin with coup plotters on the run
Summary: Nigerian air force sent troops into Benin following coup attempt . Soldiers took over the national television station and announced that President Patrice Talon had been deposed . The attempted putsch was ultimately defeated by loyalist army forces with the help of the Nigeria air force . Despite the air strikes and troop deployments the day before, calm had returned

Title: How Benin sought Nigeria’s military help to foil coup – Minister
Summary: Olushegun Bakari gave an insight into how his country called on Nigeria for military help to foil last Sunday’s coup attempt to overthrow President Patrice Talon . Bakari spoke to journalists on the sidelines of the ECOWAS Council of Ministers Summit which held in Abuja on Thursday . He lauded Nigeria and ECOW

Title: 2027: LP rules out automatic ticket for Obi
Summary: The Labour Party leadership has ruled out handing out automatic tickets to any aspirant ahead of the 2027 general elections . Former presidential candidate Peter Obi must go through competitive primaries if he chooses to return to the fold . Ifoh stressed that the party remained open to reconciliation with Obi and other aggrieved stakeholders but maintained that its internal democratic processes would

Title: Oil output rose by 35,000bpd in November – Report
Summary: Nigeria recorded one of the strongest month-on-month production gains among Organisation of the Petroleum Exporting Countries members in November 2025, pumping 1.436 million barrels per day .
